results.title: The Little Colonel
results.creator_credit: David Butler, B G De Sylva Productions and Fox Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
After a blistery Southern Colonel (Lionel Barrymore) banishes his daughter (Evelyn Venable) for marrying a Northener (John Lodge), he refuses to see her even when she returns years later with her young daughter (Shirley Temple). As outspoken as her grandfather, the ingenious child turns on plenty of charm and wins his heart. Includes a remarkable tap dance/soft-shoe routine with the famous Bill “Mr Bojangles” Robinson. In a role she makes her own, Hattie McDaniel of “Gone with the wind” fame, plays Mammy. The original production was in black and white, with the final scene shot in technicolor, however this version has been computer colourised.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Butler, B G De Sylva Productions and Fox Films

results.title: Bright eyes
results.creator_credit: David Butler, Sol Wurtzel and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
The first big film created especially for her, ‘Bright eyes’ helped make Shirley Temple a huge box-office star and features her most famous song, ‘On the good ship Lollipop’. The little darling of a group of aviators, Shirley splits her time between her pilot Godfather, Loop and her long-suffering mother who is a housemaid for a selfish, wealthy family. When a tragic accident suddenly leaves Shirley orphaned, Loop sets out to adopt Shirley - until he learns that he is not the only one determined to keep the adorable youngster. This is a colourized version of the original black and white film.

results.title: Dimples
results.creator_credit: William A. Seiter and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple stars in this delightful old-fashioned musical comedy. The cutest little girl with the biggest dimples, sings and dances her way from poverty to stardom. Ever cheerful, Little Dimples sings for money in the Bowery while her thieving Grandfather pickpockets the crowd she attracts. When a society lady adopts her, Dimples is discovered by the woman’s nephew who needs someone to play Little Eva in his upcoming production of ‘Uncle Tom’s cabin’. Charming and entertaining, this film is packed with laughs, tender moments and rousing musical numbers. This is a colourized version of the original black and white film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: William A. Seiter and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

results.title: Heidi
results.creator_credit: Allan Dwan, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple portrays the spirited young heroine of Johanna Spyri’s popular children’s novel giving her rich emotion and infinte charm. When her Aunt tires of caring for her, orphan Heidi is taken to the Swiss mountains to live with her gruff grandfather (Jean Hersholt), a hermit who comes to adore her. However, the Aunt returns to steal Heidi and sells her to a family whose invalid daughter (Marcia Mae Jones) needs a companion. Bullied by an evil governess (Mary Nash), Heidi still charms the entire household and never stops trying to return to her beloved grandfather. Colourised version.

results.title: Australian women's archival Series
results.brief_description: Each year the Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission produces an archival interview with a woman who has made a significant contribution to Australia during her lifetime.
results.description: Each year the Women’s Program of the Australian Film Commission produces an archival interview with a woman who has made a significant contribution to Australia during her lifetime.

group_works.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
group_works.creator_credit: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women's Program of the AFC

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women’s Program of the AFC

results.title: Edna Ryan: a political life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
Born in 1904, working class politics surrounded Edna Ryan as she grew up in New South Wales. As a young adult she worked for the newly formed Communist Party until she was expelled. As a socialist in wartime she eventually found a new home in the Australian Labor Party. As a feminist, she became active in the industrial courts, in 1958 she became the first woman Deputy Mayor of NSW and played a significant role in 1974 in the fight for equal pay for women.

results.title: Helping hand
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Heart of the matter”.
Explains how current EEC policy of dumping surpluss food on Third World Countries simply encourages governments to do nothing about their own problems and that cash aid is preferable as it can be used to directly improve the infrastructure. Also the logistics involved in the distribution of EEC surplus in Ethiopia.
